lines.text: Maria, would you dance with me?... Then, how about spending the rest of your life with me?
I'd rather have a case of the clap than a case of this wine.
You've got only one life to live. You can either make it chickenshit or chicken salad.
Can you keep a secret?
Yeah.
So can I.
Look, I've kept my part of the bargain for Chloe's sake.
Well, maybe Chloe deserves more than a bargain, Tom.
[strokes his cheek, then turns to Larry]
Larry Kozinski, I would love to dance with you.

[a the cemetery, declining to join the funeral group]
At my age, you don't want to get too close to an open grave.
That's a dress you wear to a hooker's wedding.
You still want to kill people?
Na, they're too stupid.
You're telling me - your grandfather's marrying the Bermuda Triangle!

[ater Edie reluctantly accepts his dinner invitation]
You've made an old man very happy!
You're not so old.
Yeah, I know, and I'm not so happy.

[at the funeral]
So, Grandpa, how come you didn't come to the church?
God makes me nervous when you get him indoors - besides, I don't like to see people in their coffins. They always look so much smaller without their spirits.
How many jobs did you have?
I don't know. A lot. I change every two or three years. If it looks like I might be successful. I move on.
You don't want to be successful?
I want to be happy.
We could shave their heads.
